description: Indulge in a decadent, warm chocolate lava cake with a molten chocolate center. This recipe is perfect for a special occasion or a cozy night in. Bake time is crucial for achieving the perfect lava center!

steps.description: In a heatproof bowl set over a simmering pot of water (or in the microwave in 30-second intervals), melt the chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth. Be careful not to burn the chocolate.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until pale and slightly thickened. This will incorporate air and help the cake rise.
Gently fold the melted chocolate mixture into the egg mixture. Then, fold in the flour and salt until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.
Grease and flour two 6-ounce ramekins. This will prevent the cakes from sticking.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared ramekins.
Bake in a preheated oven at 425°F (220°C) for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still soft. The baking time may vary depending on your oven.
Let the cakes cool in the ramekins for a minute or two before inverting them onto plates.
Dust with powdered sugar, if desired, and serve immediately while the center is still molten.

conclusion: Enjoy your warm and delicious chocolate lava cake! The key is to get the baking time just right to achieve that perfect molten center. Serve immediately for the best experience.
